title: Google\Cloud\Dataflow\V1beta3\Job
name: Job
description:
Defines a job to be run by the Cloud Dataflow service.

Generated from protobuf message google.dataflow.v1beta3.Job

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.id
params.description: The unique ID of this job. This field is set by the Cloud Dataflow service when the Job is created, and is immutable for the life of the job.

params.name: data.project_id
params.description: The ID of the Cloud Platform project that the job belongs to.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The user-specified Cloud Dataflow job name. Only one Job with a given name may exist in a project at any given time. If a caller attempts to create a Job with the same name as an already-existing Job, the attempt returns the existing Job. The name must match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]{0,1022}[a-z0-9])?

params.name: data.type
params.description: The type of Cloud Dataflow job.

params.name: data.environment
params.description: The environment for the job.

params.name: data.steps
params.description: Exactly one of step or steps_location should be specified. The top-level steps that constitute the entire job. Only retrieved with JOB_VIEW_ALL.

params.name: data.steps_location
params.description: The Cloud Storage location where the steps are stored.

params.name: data.current_state
params.description: The current state of the job. Jobs are created in the JOB_STATE_STOPPED state unless otherwise specified. A job in the JOB_STATE_RUNNING state may asynchronously enter a terminal state. After a job has reached a terminal state, no further state updates may be made. This field may be mutated by the Cloud Dataflow service; callers cannot mutate it.

params.name: data.current_state_time
params.description: The timestamp associated with the current state.

params.name: data.requested_state
params.description: The job's requested state. UpdateJob may be used to switch between the JOB_STATE_STOPPED and JOB_STATE_RUNNING states, by setting requested_state. UpdateJob may also be used to directly set a job's requested state to JOB_STATE_CANCELLED or JOB_STATE_DONE, irrevocably terminating the job if it has not already reached a terminal state.

params.name: data.execution_info
params.description: Deprecated.

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: The timestamp when the job was initially created. Immutable and set by the Cloud Dataflow service.

params.name: data.replace_job_id
params.description: If this job is an update of an existing job, this field is the job ID of the job it replaced. When sending a CreateJobRequest, you can update a job by specifying it here. The job named here is stopped, and its intermediate state is transferred to this job.

params.name: data.transform_name_mapping
params.description: The map of transform name prefixes of the job to be replaced to the corresponding name prefixes of the new job.

params.name: data.client_request_id
params.description: The client's unique identifier of the job, re-used across retried attempts. If this field is set, the service will ensure its uniqueness. The request to create a job will fail if the service has knowledge of a previously submitted job with the same client's ID and job name. The caller may use this field to ensure idempotence of job creation across retried attempts to create a job. By default, the field is empty and, in that case, the service ignores it.

params.name: data.replaced_by_job_id
params.description: If another job is an update of this job (and thus, this job is in JOB_STATE_UPDATED), this field contains the ID of that job.

params.name: data.temp_files
params.description: A set of files the system should be aware of that are used for temporary storage. These temporary files will be removed on job completion. No duplicates are allowed. No file patterns are supported. The supported files are: Google Cloud Storage: storage.googleapis.com/{bucket}/{object} bucket.storage.googleapis.com/{object}

params.name: data.labels
params.description: User-defined labels for this job. The labels map can contain no more than 64 entries. Entries of the labels map are UTF8 strings that comply with the following restrictions: Keys must conform to regexp: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}][\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}_-]{0,62} Values must conform to regexp: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}_-]{0,63} * Both keys and values are additionally constrained to be <= 128 bytes in size.

params.name: data.location
params.description: The [regional endpoint] (https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/concepts/regional-endpoints) that contains this job.

params.name: data.pipeline_description
params.description: Preliminary field: The format of this data may change at any time. A description of the user pipeline and stages through which it is executed. Created by Cloud Dataflow service. Only retrieved with JOB_VIEW_DESCRIPTION or JOB_VIEW_ALL.

params.name: data.stage_states
params.description: This field may be mutated by the Cloud Dataflow service; callers cannot mutate it.

params.name: data.job_metadata
params.description: This field is populated by the Dataflow service to support filtering jobs by the metadata values provided here. Populated for ListJobs and all GetJob views SUMMARY and higher.

params.name: data.start_time
params.description: The timestamp when the job was started (transitioned to JOB_STATE_PENDING). Flexible resource scheduling jobs are started with some delay after job creation, so start_time is unset before start and is updated when the job is started by the Cloud Dataflow service. For other jobs, start_time always equals to create_time and is immutable and set by the Cloud Dataflow service.

params.name: data.created_from_snapshot_id
params.description: If this is specified, the job's initial state is populated from the given snapshot.

params.name: data.satisfies_pzs
params.description: Reserved for future use. This field is set only in responses from the server; it is ignored if it is set in any requests.

methods.name: getCurrentState
methods.description:
The current state of the job.

Jobs are created in the JOB_STATE_STOPPED state unless otherwise specified. A job in the JOB_STATE_RUNNING state may asynchronously enter a terminal state. After a job has reached a terminal state, no further state updates may be made. This field may be mutated by the Cloud Dataflow service; callers cannot mutate it.

methods.name: getClientRequestId
methods.description:
The client's unique identifier of the job, re-used across retried attempts.

If this field is set, the service will ensure its uniqueness. The request to create a job will fail if the service has knowledge of a previously submitted job with the same client's ID and job name. The caller may use this field to ensure idempotence of job creation across retried attempts to create a job. By default, the field is empty and, in that case, the service ignores it.

Generated from protobuf field string client_request_id = 14;

The caller may use this field to ensure idempotence of job creation across retried attempts to create a job. By default, the field is empty and, in that case, the service ignores it.

methods.name: getTempFiles
methods.description:
A set of files the system should be aware of that are used for temporary storage. These temporary files will be removed on job completion.

No duplicates are allowed. No file patterns are supported. The supported files are: Google Cloud Storage: storage.googleapis.com/{bucket}/{object} bucket.storage.googleapis.com/{object}

Generated from protobuf field repeated string temp_files = 16;

methods.name: setTempFiles
methods.description:

No duplicates are allowed. No file patterns are supported. The supported files are: Google Cloud Storage: storage.googleapis.com/{bucket}/{object} bucket.storage.googleapis.com/{object}

Generated from protobuf field repeated string temp_files = 16;

params.name: var
params.description:
A set of files the system should be aware of that are used for temporary storage. These temporary files will be removed on job completion.

No duplicates are allowed. No file patterns are supported. The supported files are: Google Cloud Storage: storage.googleapis.com/{bucket}/{object} bucket.storage.googleapis.com/{object}

methods.name: getLabels
methods.description:
User-defined labels for this job.

The labels map can contain no more than 64 entries. Entries of the labels map are UTF8 strings that comply with the following restrictions:

  • Keys must conform to regexp: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}][\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}_-]{0,62}
  • Values must conform to regexp: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}_-]{0,63}
  • Both keys and values are additionally constrained to be <= 128 bytes in size.

Generated from protobuf field map<string, string> labels = 17;

methods.name: setLabels
methods.description:

The labels map can contain no more than 64 entries. Entries of the labels map are UTF8 strings that comply with the following restrictions:

  • Keys must conform to regexp: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}][\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}_-]{0,62}
  • Values must conform to regexp: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}_-]{0,63}
  • Both keys and values are additionally constrained to be <= 128 bytes in size.

Generated from protobuf field map<string, string> labels = 17;

  • Values must conform to regexp: [\p{Ll}\p{Lo}\p{N}_-]{0,63}
  • Both keys and values are additionally constrained to be <= 128 bytes in size.

methods.name: getStartTime
methods.description:
The timestamp when the job was started (transitioned to JOB_STATE_PENDING).

Flexible resource scheduling jobs are started with some delay after job creation, so start_time is unset before start and is updated when the job is started by the Cloud Dataflow service. For other jobs, start_time always equals to create_time and is immutable and set by the Cloud Dataflow service.
